alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 3:59PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. .Heavy rainfall expected today and Wednesday will cause the river levels to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 31.5 feet, the main road of the Schell Osage Conservation Area floods west of the conservation office. The north campground main road of the Schell Osage Conservation area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 27.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CDT.
